DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether hydration with sodium bicarbonate is more effective than hydration with sodium chloride to prevent contrast induced nephropathy in patients undergoing Primary Coronary Intervention for Acute ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction.
DOC.brief_title: Hydration and Contrast-Induced Nephropathy in Primary Angioplasty
DOC.criteria: patients with Acute ST Elevation Myocardial Infarction submitted to Primary Intervention refusal to consent previous contrast exposure within 72 hours
